title: Patriots 21, Buccaneers 16 (3rd): Tampa claws back into game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs scored a last-second touchdown in the second quarter, giving the Patriots a 14-10 lead over the Buccaneers.
Baker Mayfield connected with Tez Johnson for a touchdown, bringing the Buccaneers closer in a 21-16 game against the Patriots.
Terrell Jennings was ruled out with a knee injury, while Marcus Jones and Christian Barmore returned after brief injury concerns.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, was charged with drunk driving after allegedly crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty at the Charlestown Municipal Court and was released on personal recognizance.
The officer has been placed on modified duty pending court proceedings scheduled for Dec. 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits remain in federal custody after a November 4 ICE raid.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reports sparse information on the detainees, citing ICE's delay in updating their locator database.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley and local officials condemn the raid, calling for legal support and describing actions as kidnapping.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on Nov. 8, marking the fifth episode of the show's 51st season.
Musical guest Sombr performed during Glaser's 'SNL' episode, which also featured Pete Davidson on 'Weekend Update'.
Glaser's popularity rose after the 2024 Tom Brady roast, leading to hosting gigs like the Golden Globes.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial goal for the Boston Bruins against the Toronto Maple Leafs on November 8, 2025.
Minten joined the Bruins from Toronto last season; his goal helped secure Boston's sixth consecutive victory.
Coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as the 'best player on the ice' during the game in which Boston beat Toronto 5-3.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame during weekend-long festivities in Toronto.
Chara shared his induction with former Bruin Joe Thornton, both part of the 2025 Hall of Fame class.
Chara, a Stanley Cup champion and seven-time All-Star, served as Bruins' captain for 14 years.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox positioned to be active in MLB free agency, with $25 million under the first luxury tax threshold.
Alex Bregman, a key target, favored by insiders to re-sign with Boston despite mixed predictions.
Red Sox considered a potential destination for free agents like Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, and Munetaka Murakami.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on Nov. 7, 2025, celebrating 20 years since his debut album.
The concert featured a mix of songs from 'Get Lifted' and covers, including The Beatles and Kanye West.
Legend's performance included personal reflections and audience interactions, highlighting his musical journey and versatility.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic on Friday.
Brown previously expressed dissatisfaction with referees during Monday's loss to the Jazz, calling a missed call 'unacceptable.'
Despite his criticism, Brown was not fined for his comments about the officiating in the game against the Jazz.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield leads the 6-2 Buccaneers with MVP-caliber performance, excelling in deep throws despite recent dips.
Rookie Emeka Egbuka, with 562 receiving yards and five touchdowns, vies for Offensive Rookie of the Year amid injury challenges.
Buccaneers face injury issues with key players like Mike Evans and Chris Godwin out, impacting their offensive lineup.
